subtitle: This recipe uses leftover or ready cooked salmon and turns it into a good supper dish.

method.text: RolI out pastry thinly and cut into 15 cm squares - one for each portion. Fold each square in half diagonally and make two cuts, about 12.5cm long, from the folded edge towards the point. Open out the squares and place on a baking sheet. Brush the two cut pieces with beaten egg then fold over to meet the opposite corner, forming a case. Brush all over with beaten egg.
Bake for 15 min until well risen and golden. Reduce oven temperature to 180°C.

Heat the butter and add flour to make a roux, cook gently for 2 - 3 min. Remove from heat and gradually blend in milk. Bring to boil, stirring continuously, to make a thick, smooth sauce. Add <sup>3</sup>/<sub>4</sub> of the grated cheese and stir until melted. Season.

Remove any bones and skin from salmon and flake. Add to sauce with prawns and broccoli. Fill pastry cases with this mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake for 15 min. Any extra filling can be reheated and served with the caskets.

title: Salmon, prawn and broccoli caskets
